These keys are from the NIST Cryptographic Algorithms Validation Suite
(CAVS) example files for key agreement (KAS), 17.4, Dec 22, 2014. (The
CAVS has a large number of test pairs, but we're not trying to
validate the underlying implementation here, just our interface to
it. So I've extracted a few examples that should cover the different
parameters we pass in.)

kas-p256-8-cavs:
-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
MIGHAgEAMBMGByqGSM49AgEGCCqGSM49AwEHBG0wawIBAQQgkxc0XIUSa8vNwIio
5XFcPqbkW28OPXVGCoyq6crqiJ+hRANCAARzuWG9QwG2SBRe1dup+G2w416acqIk
wngsD94mNugcIJH2Hn/S0Kp0DavI0Mqsx0njBDoxh37U56iCGy9f/7dc
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----

kas-p256-8-iut:
-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----

pLH/OpER+pffZ8idCXZx2hwCAuOhRANCAASmeHu05yzKrlRhohAl6h4P1L+1YXPn
cIa+LeY/tZTVzAYC59OGMDvrMXctZ6wD7bn+42SQPb2BP/Pxk4Tihf+Q
-----END PRIVATE KEY-----

These additional keys test some cases that the CAVS key pairs don't.

ephem-p256-1:
-----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY-----
MIGHAgEAMBMGByqGSM49AgEGCCqGSM49AwEHBG0wawIBAQQgTM6pI8m1LVuVyiel
